text: and I've just watched that bit of a
broadcast it is very harrowing viewing
it has to be said what was happening it
was a normal breakfast TV program it was
going out at 6:45 local time live you
see the interviewer Alison Parker who
just turned 24 years old she was
interviewing a woman about tourism in
the area suddenly there are 8 shots very
distinctive shots quite close the camera
falls over there are screams you see
very briefly what appears to be a man
with a gun just a very brief glimpse of
that individual the camera remains on
the ground and then they at that point
obviously they they cut back to the
studio now this as I say was breakfast
television it was going out live when
this happened the station manager of
that station has confirmed that both the
cameraman and as you say the reporter on
the scene were both killed in that
shooting and there are police now on the
scene they say that the individual who
fired the shots is still at large he is
still on the loose there is a manhunt
underway at this moment they have sealed
off the perimeter of local schools they
are asking people to keep an eye out for
this individual but obviously not to
tackle him and to try and stay indoors
so this is still playing out at the
moment in that area which is about four
hours or so drive from here in
Washington DC in Virginia hmm
desperately sad it sounds like it might
have been an opportunistic sort of thing
Richard I mean obviously this is the
risk isn't it with live television
there's no way you can control what
people around you are doing that is that
is the problem of course we don't really
know exactly what the motive for this
shooting was we don't know whether this
individual had deliberately targeted
them because they happen to be live on
air or for other reasons we simply don't
know enough about the situation at the
moment to be able to speculate on that
shooting deaths are not uncommon in the
United States there are something like
and these are the figures for 2013 30
people killed by gunshot fire which
weren't suicides every day of the year
in 2013 so you know there were
there are certainly a lot of gunshot
deaths in the United States and at this
stage we simply don't know whether these
two were deliberately targeted or
whether they happen to be in the wrong
place at the wrong time
